name: AudioProcessor
description: A specialized agent for audio analysis, effects, transformations, and source separation.

skills.name: Audio Analysis
skills.description: Analyze audio files to extract features, generate visualizations, and interpret audio content.

examples.input: Generate a mel spectrogram for my audio file.
examples.output: Here's the mel spectrogram visualization for your audio. The brighter areas represent higher intensity across the frequency spectrum.

examples.input: Can you detect the beats in this song?
examples.output: I've analyzed your audio and detected 120 beats at a tempo of 128 BPM.

skills.name: Audio Effects
skills.description: Apply professional audio effects like reverb, delay, compression, and EQ to audio files.

examples.input: Add reverb to make this recording sound like it's in a large hall.
examples.output: I've applied a reverb effect with a large room size and moderate damping to simulate a hall environment. You can listen to the processed audio now.

examples.input: Can you apply compression to make this vocal recording more even?
examples.output: I've applied compression with a threshold of -20dB and ratio of 4:1 to even out the dynamics of the vocal track.

skills.name: Audio Transformation
skills.description: Transform audio characteristics like tempo, pitch, and sample rate without degrading quality.

examples.input: Speed up this audio by 20% without changing the pitch.
examples.output: I've time-stretched your audio to play 20% faster while preserving the original pitch. The new duration is 48 seconds.

examples.input: Pitch this vocal up by two semitones.
examples.output: I've shifted the pitch up by two semitones while maintaining the original duration. The vocal is now in a higher key.

skills.name: Audio Source Separation
skills.description: Separate audio into component parts like vocals, drums, bass, and other instruments.

examples.input: Extract the vocals from this song.
examples.output: I've separated the vocals from the instrumental track. You can now access both the isolated vocals and the backing track separately.

examples.input: Can you create a karaoke version of this track?
examples.output: I've created a karaoke version by removing the vocals while preserving the instrumental parts of the track.
